title: Re: Gonzales, Gilbert / 30154194552 - Post 2004/MD Response - 04/01/16 - MOD
content:
Hi Shelby,

Regarding the updated status we received from Dr. Hammani on Gilbert Gonzales,

PTP & Phone #: Dr. Hammani 626-939-5900

I just got off of the phone with Oliver at Dr. Hammani's office, 626-939-5900. Oliver read me the statuses from the 02/25/16 and 03/31/16 MD visits. Oliver started by reading to me the 03/31/16 status which was "The patient may return to modified duties as of 03/31/2016; patient is limited to no lifting greater than 20 pounds; patient is limited to no frequent bending or stooping." I explained to Oliver that I was trying to clear up an apparent discrepancy between the lifting limit on the 03/31/16 report and the lifting limit on the 02/25/16 report. Oliver stated that the work status from the 02/25/16 report was the same as the work status from the 03/31/16 report, he read the status from 02/25/16 to me ; "The patient may return to modified duties as of 02/25/2016; patient is limited to no lifting greater than 20 pounds; patient is limited to no frequent bending or stooping." I asked Oliver if he would please fax me the reports in question. He agreed to do so and they arrived swiftly as well as a report from 03/10/2016. All 3 reports indicate the same work status ; "...patient is limited to no lifting greater than 20 pounds; patient is limited to no frequent bending or stooping". I have attached all three reports as one .pdf file for your perusal.

Thank you for providing me with the opportunity to be of service.

Have a great day !
Sincerely,

P Howland
Focus On Intervention
Return To Work Coordinator
phowland@focusonintervention.com
